message.content:
I need to calculate six financial ratios based on the provided financial statements. Let me work through them step by step:

1) Free Cash Flow (FCF):
   FCF = Operating Cash Flow - Capital Expenditures
   Operating Cash Flow = -17,417,367.15
   Capital Expenditures = 0
   FCF = -17,417,367.15 - 0 = -17,417,367.15

2) Return on Assets (ROA):
   ROA = Net Income / Average Total Assets × 100%
   Net Income = 405,999.64
   Average Total Assets = (28,000,000 + 29,133,140.32) / 2 = 28,566,570.16
   ROA = (405,999.64 / 28,566,570.16) × 100% = 1.42%

3) Return on Equity (ROE):
   ROE = Net Income / Average Shareholders' Equity × 100%
   Net Income = 405,999.64
   Average Shareholders' Equity = (28,000,000 + 28,405,999.64) / 2 = 28,202,999.82
   ROE = (405,999.64 / 28,202,999.82) × 100% = 1.44%

4) Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio:
   OCF to NI Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Income
   Operating Cash Flow = -17,417,367.15
   Net Income = 405,999.64
   OCF to NI Ratio = -17,417,367.15 / 405,999.64 = -42.90

5) Net Profit Margin:
   Net Profit Margin = Net Income / Total Revenue × 100%
   Net Income = 405,999.64
   Total Revenue = 14,542,813.42
   Net Profit Margin = (405,999.64 / 14,542,813.42) × 100% = 2.79%

6) Gross Profit Margin:
   Gross Profit Margin = Gross Profit / Total Revenue × 100%
   Gross Profit = 4,142,813.42
   Total Revenue = 14,542,813.42
   Gross Profit Margin = (4,142,813.42 / 14,542,813.42) × 100% = 28.49%

{"solution": {'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-17417367.15', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '1.42%', 'Return on Equity (ROE)': '1.44%', 'Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio': '-42.90', 'Net Profit Margin': '2.79%', 'Gross Profit Margin': '28.49%'}}
